results.title: Secrets of nature: the nightingale
results.brief_description: Life and characteristics of the nightingale; from North Africa the birds reach woodland districts in southern England in April; comparison of the nightingale and the robin; the song of the birds; nesting sites, type of nest, color of eggs, hatching; feeding the young from the first hatching of eggs until the fledglings leave the nest.

results.title: Secrets of nature: summertime meadow
results.creator_credit: Associated British-Pathe and British Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Views of typical animal and plant life to be found in an English meadow during summer; ladybirds feeding on aphids; meadow flowers and pollination by bees; snails; grasses and grasshoppers; the looper caterpillar, drinker moth and millipede; swallow-tail butterfly; burnet moths; blue, marbled white, fritillary butterflies; various types of meadow grasses.

results.title: Secrets of nature: gnats
results.creator_credit: Associated British-Pathe and British Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Shows the life cycle of the gnat; laying of eggs in batches of two to three hundred; emergence of the larvae; structure of the larvae showing head, thorax, abdomen in ten sections; head equipped with compound eyes; feelers; bristled jaw and breathjing tube; effect of oil layer on surface of water; change to pupae; emergence of the winged insects; biting action of the female gnat.

results.title: Secrets of nature: daphnia (water fleas)
results.creator_credit: Associated British-Pathe and British Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Microcinematography of the crystalline and long-tailed water fleas. Shows the digestive system, the heart, the eye and the reproductive methods of the common water flea.

results.title: Secrets and lies
results.creator_credit: Simon Channing-Williams, CiBy 2000, Thin Man Films, Channel 4 Films and Mike Leigh
results.brief_description:
Cynthia is an unmarried factory worker who lives in a state of siege with her perpetually enraged daughter, Roxanne. In sharp contrast, Cynthia’s brother, Maurice, runs a thriving photographic studio and works hard to provide a luxury home for his neurotic, childless wife. Meanwhile, an adopted young black woman, Hortense, is scouring London for her real mother, who, she learns to her shock, is white. An acutely accurate portrait of familial tensions, which reflects Leigh’s practice of carrying out months of intensive workshopping with his actors before beginning to shoot. The film remains true to its subjects even as the story veers from comedy to tragedy. Also available on 16mm.

Credits: Producer, Simon Channing-Williams ; director, writer, Mike Leigh ; photography, Dick Pope ; music, Andrew Dickson.
Cast: Timothy Spall, Brenda Blethyn, Phyllis Logan, Marianne Jean-Baptiste, Claire Rushbrook, Rin Cook, Lesley Manville, Elizabeth Berrington, Michelle Austin, Lee Ross, Emma Amos, Hannah Davis.

results.title: Secrets
results.creator_credit: Alan Lowery and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Last dream: a special report by John Pilger”.
Part two of John Pilger’s personal view of Australian history and identity. This part is about the past catching up with the present. Behind the Bicentennial ballyhoo, the original Australians are treated as badly as many blacks in South Africa; and, for an increasing number of whites, the old egalitarian ways no longer have a place in a media conscious “lucky country” which now produces fine wines, films and thousands of overnight millionaires whilst many of its children are living in poverty.

results.title: Secret world: around the bay
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Life Australia”.
There is life in Port Phillip Bay. Fascinating close-up photography demonstrates sea-creatures breathing, eating, propelling themselves and watching each other. Also shows some of the techniques of underwater exploration and some of the laboratory techniques of observing and classifying newly discovered life-forms.

results.title: Secret women's business
results.brief_description: We hide behind clothes. We hide behind hair. We hide behind jewellery. And all of a sudden none of that’s there… A warm documentary about women’s experience of their bodies in a Korean Bathhouse at Sydney’s Kings Cross. Snippets of voices slide over lush cinematography as the corporeal and the emotional melt in this bathing experience.

results.title: Secret wedding
results.creator_credit: Allarts, Cogurccio, Cinephile and Alejandro Agresti
results.brief_description: Fermin (Tito Haas) is found in the streets of Buenos Aires, with no recollection of his past, 15 years after he had disappeared and was presumed dead. He returns to the village where he had left behind Tota (Mirtha Busnelli) the woman he promised to wed, but since his arrest by the Junta, she has become so absorbed in his memory that she doesn’t recognise him. As he attempts to resume his life, the conservative power structures in the town (the church and the military) find his presence threatening as they discover his true identity.
